answers.answer: What are your actual thyroid hormone levels?  Please post results, along with reference ranges from your most recent test, since ranges vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.Are you eating properly?  Exercising at all?  It sounds like the weight you're losing is mostly muscle.  Cutting calories and not getting exercise can cause that, but there may be something else wrong.You really need to talk to your doctor and find out what's causing your problem, then get on a program to correct it.

question: Hi. Im 34 f. I suffer from hyperthyroid, type 2 diabetes, and have been loosing weight and loosing my muscles on my legs.My legs feel very heavy, i get the feeling like ive been swimming for hours and just got out of the pool...well thats the heaviness I feel.My calfs have gotten about 1/2 the size they were within the last 1yr. ]Last night I was in the kitchen preparing my babies bottle, well I dropped the bottle so I bent down to get it, and I just dropped! i fell so hard I and didnt have any strenght to lift myself up. I had to yell out for my husband . He even had to carry me to my bed cause I had no leg strenght to lift my leg to get on the bed.I am very worried and would like some suggestions.
title: Heavy leg,no strenght, and hyperthyroidism, diabietes type2
